title: keen sound
content:
for keen 4,5,and 6, I can't hear any adlib sound. I think it's because my sound card is too new. I don't know much about sound drivers, do I need to get a specific one to make the sound work?

I tested the games on a windows 98 and xp.

title: Re: keen sound
content: You need [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/vdmsound/]VDMSound[/url] or [url=http://dosbox.sourceforge.net]DOSBox[/url], because your sound card does not natively support Keen's SoundBlaster sounds.

title: Re: keen sound
content:
1. Did you see if the music was on or the speakers were turned up?
2. If not, try using DOSbox.
3. If that doesn't work, try VDMsound.
4. If you don't hear anything still, try turning the speakers up - some computers (well, mine anyway) plays keen music really quietly.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: keen sound
content:
The speakers were up. I guess I'll try dosbox.

Edit: Just downloaded. When I install it and run it, do I just run keen like I would on normal dos?

title: Re: keen sound
content:
No, just drag the keen icon onto the dosbox icon.

Otherwise you have to type "mount C C:\" (or whatever drive keen is on), then you have to go to that drive and go all the way into the keen folder.

Which one do you think is easier? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]


Also nice avatar! lol[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: keen sound
content:
thanks. that's sounds alot easier than doing all that cd space junk.

stinkoman!

title: keen sound... keen sideways?
content:
well, it works. the sound is almost exactly the same. the only strange thing is that I can't get it to go full screen. thanks again.

i noticed that those titles that you see just before you enter a level are actually their full length it seems (time on screen).

Edit: Here's what I'm scared of though, I was playing K4 for a bit and suddenly the screen goes black. A few seconds later, it comes back on... but the screen did a 90 degree clockwise rotation. When I moved the mouse I had to move it side to side to get it over to the shut down. But when I restarted it still is sideways. I think I remember an option on the control panel to change this, lemme check.

title: Re: keen sound... keen sideways?
content:
"well, it works. the sound is almost exactly the same. the only strange thing is that I can't get it to go full screen. thanks again."

I don't think there's an option for fullscreen. I never checked, though.

"i noticed that those titles that you see just before you enter a level are actually their full length it seems (time on screen)."

Yeah, dosbox runs pretty slow. At least you can read it now (it usually goes too fast for me.) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]


"Edit: Here's what I'm scared of though, I was playing K4 for a bit and suddenly the screen goes black. A few seconds later, it comes back on... but the screen did a 90 degree clockwise rotation. When I moved the mouse I had to move it side to side to get it over to the shut down. But when I restarted it still is sideways. I think I remember an option on the control panel to change this, lemme check."

Wierd.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: keen sideways!!!
content:
well. there's no settings I can see on the display or display - advanced or system that would let you rotate the screen.

but wait... here's an idea... hmmm... I move the mouse to point to the right and then I pick my monitor up and lay it down on it's side. then I won't have to hurt my neck anymore.

but seriously folks, has anybody heard of an option to change your screen's.................. degree?

H
E
L
P

title: Re: keen sideways!!!
content:
You can use Fullscreen with DOSBox, just edit the config file with Notepad (You should be able to just go to Start>Programs>Dosbox>DOSBox.conf. Then scroll to where is says fullscreen=false and change it to say fullscreen=true. You might also want to change some of those other settings to get it to work how you want.-----
[img]http://gnosticus.spatang.com/PBF056BCPuppyWish.jpg[/img]

title: I got it to work
content:
Who would have thought it was under the Intel options for the graphics card?

apparently they have these hotkeys, and one was ctrl-alt-right and it makes you screen rotate 270. I didn't have these hotkeys enabled (that was another option) but it must have done it when I tried to jump, pogo, and move at the same time.

title: Re: I got it to work
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr] Who would have thought it was under the Intel options for the graphics card?[hr][/quote]...I was just going to suggest that, apparently a lot of people with the same video card have this problem because they have no idea that there are shortcut keys.

As to the DOSBox thing, you don't need to edit your config file, just press Alt+Enter to switch between a window and fullscreen - that's a pretty standard shortcut, it works with the normal command line and it used to work with most Windows games as well.
